alert.note: Alert for Dewey (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 23 at 7:18PM MDT by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Dewey County through 745 PM MDT... At 718 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Parade, or 9 miles east of Eagle Butte, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of south central Dewey County, including the following locations... Cheyenne River Reservation. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
